intro: Corycium alticola, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine pubescence. Corycium alticola is known for its pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer.
